text: I replaced my Rainbird controller with the RACHIO 3 about two months ago.  My somewhat non-standard schedule was extremely easy to set up using the RACHIO app.  The app is intuitively structured and the system works fantastically!  The controller omits cycles when rainfall matches your preset amount or in instances of high winds, seasonally adjusts the length of each cycle as the season changes and your schedule(s) can be easily edited if needed. Excellent system!

title: Awesome support staff
text: Having an app to perform a task well is one thing. But, to have a customer support team behind the scenes to help out a consumer’s needs. Now that is awesome. Many companies claim to have email/phone support but, sadly most don’t. Rachio on the other hand has a support team that Rocks!!! They are always there whether a simple question or, a problem that may arise. Thank you for having a great team supporting an already great product!!!

title: So convenient
text: The best thing about the controller is that you can instaneously turn on or off the zones  with the smart phone in the yard while checking their operation and adjusting the sprinkler heads without having to go repeatedly back to the controller in the garage each time.  The zones also have adjustable individual operation times and you can turn adjust them with the app

title: Makes gardening so much easier
text: We have kind of an elaborate drip system set up in our backyard flower garden and maintaining it with the Rachio hardware and phone app is so much easier than it used to be. Easy to use and powerful, Rachio is a joy to use. The localized weather prevents watering on windy days and if we have already had enough rain, saving water with no additional hardware. Great tool Rachio, thanks.

title: Best timer ever
text: I have used Rachio for years now, and I will never go back to the old timers.  Setup may seem like a lot but trust me it is worth it.  I don’t have to worry about adjusting the times because some zones are getting too much water while others are getting too little.  Rachio looks at the local weather and automatically adjusts my schedule!  I absolutely love it!

title: Better!
text:
I have used scores of water controllers over the last 50 years and nothing is more intuitive, adaptable, flexible or responsive to environmental changes than my Rachio! 
To be fair, we didn’t have the internet or wifi 50 years ago, so maybe i could limit my effusive praise. But it is a great and reliable controller for my lawn sprinklers, my garden soakers and my Apple tree drip systems.

title: End By Sunrise broken for years
text: Set my 11 zone system to End By Sunrise and Flex Daily. Rachio takes the runtime for my entire system, then sets the start time for the few zones it runs each day to what my entire system would require. Therefore, Rachio is running a few zones at about 11:30PM to about 2:00AM, when I have it set for End At Sunrise! I checked the customer forums, and there are complaints going back a couple years. This would be an easy algorithm to fix, but Rachio has no intent of doing so for these larger systems. I have reluctantly changed my system to more manual settings and abandoned the defective End By Sunrise.

title: Problems at first, but seems to have sorted itself out
text:
If you have a Rachio 2, you will find installing the new model in its place to be quite easy. 

At first I experienced erratic behavior with the Rachio 3. WiFi connectivity seemed less stable than my Rachio 2 and zones would run endlessly. After several reboots of the Rachio 3 as well as my iPhone, things have gotten sorted out and zone timing and switching has improved and become reliable. I have had much fewer WiFi disconnects also than at first. 

The new app is less intuitive initially than the old one but once you get familiar with it you can appreciate the changes.

Update:  Still find that manual runs are problematic. Zone gets stuck and 
midway through resets time and keeps looping. I have to pull the power on the controller to stop the run.

title: Excellent customer service
text: I’ve had this product for several years and each year I have problems turning it back on after winter, since I am not that tech saavy. However, whenever I have called customer service, I get to talk to someone immediately and they help me resolve the issue right away. Strongly recommend this product.

title: So easy and convenient
text:
This smart sprinkler and app have helped me so much. I was always struggling with the manual control and set up and test run. 

Since having this I can allow more water at certain zones and test each zone to see which ones have problems with the sprinkler heads to adjust and get more water on the grass instead of outside.

title: Poorly designed UI hides basic features
text:
This has turned into a mess. Rachio tries to “smart feature” you to the point that is difficult to make basic changes. Feature layout, nested features, it’s junk and need to be completely re thought. They basically want to sell you a new unit and weather upgrades so they make the existing product as difficult to use as possible. As a VP of marketing and former product manager, this is junk.

Show me a screen where I can easily set up and adjust schedules. Should be at top level of the UI next to irrigation.

title: This is a feature packed application
text: Running my irrigation system with this application is easy and straightforward using this web browser interface. I can water my garden wherever I am and check water usage history. It has smart features that changes the watering pattern Based on prevailing weather conditions in the local area.

title: So easy to manage!
text: Rachio makes sprinkler management really easy.  Best features are that both long term scheduling and off-schedule changes can all be set up while sitting in any wifi area (like the kitchen table), on my phone rather than standing in a hot, dark garage, on a complicated panel.  Plus it can make its own automatic adjustments based on local weather conditions!  Its awesome!!

title: So much better!!!
text: I wish I had installed the Rachio system and app years ago. It is very easy to set up and monitor, and it pushes information about the system and the weather adjustments it makes regularly. It is an excellent way to minimize overwatering and the waste that comes from outmoded or ineffective rain sensors, which at best can only look backwards.

title: "Smart Watering" could easily be made WAY smarter!
text: If it's windy when the so-called "Smart Watering" wants to water, the entire day will be skipped.  Would be so easy to keep monitoring the wind and wait for the wind to die down and proceed with watering.  If the wind never dies down, then add additional watering to the next day's cycle.  Same for rain.  If the forecast is for rain and we don't actually get as much rain as expected, then make an adjustment and just try watering a little later the same day, or add additional time to the next day.  So easy!  It's just SOFTWARE.  Make it so!

title: Best Irrigation System Ever!
text: Just upgraded from Rachio 1 to the new Rachio 3. Wow! I expected minor improvements but boy was I pleasantly surprised. I’ve been loving my Rachio 1 ever since I first got it and expect to be hooking up the new Wireless Flow Meter next month when it is released. Love saving money, water, and seeing my garden flourish. Only complaint- Rachio! Why don’t you make one with 24 stations!! (I run a 16 and an 8 which works fine, but a 24 would be so sweet!)

title: Underestimates water need
text:
Rachio website does not have feedback option. So, it underestimates my yard’s water needs. Unless it feels like it must require savings from lack of watering.
I’m starting to think that Rachio wants to prove diminished water usuage (which I think it can perform) by doing what the Federal Government suggested...set your thermostat at night to 82 degrees in Houston, Texas. One size does not fit all.
I’ve added schedules to help my grass to return. Rachio should not put out blanket watering, that seems personalized. Actually decreased my watering schedule in August. Craziness!!!

title: Best watering timer I’ve seen to date
text:
Love the recent updates. Example the quick watering feature. I can select which zones I need to water and select a time for all zones or select a time for each zone. 
Usually when any app is updated it gets worse. Thanks for really testing these app updates before releasing them to us!!!

title: Rachio app is great when when priming the pump.
text: Every spring, when it’s time to bring the the lake fed irrigation system back up, the Rachio app allows me turn the pump on and off remotely (out at the pump on the on the lakeshore) which helps solve pump priming challenges.  I really enjoy being able to control all aspects of my irrigation system from my phone.  It’s a true luxury!

title: Easy Control of Irrigation
text: Used to have a PC only based system that needed a remote to function. Now my gardener snd i have access from our iphones & ipads. If a sprinkler head in a zone breaks, that zone can easily be temporarily removed from system. Special temporary schedules for new planting NO PROBLEM. The best system i’ve had in 35yrs of trying. Highly recommend.

title: This system is so easy to use!
text: I love how simple this system is to use! I can adjust my schedule anytime from anywhere. If I see a section in my lawn that needs extra attention, I can start a quick run and I’m done. It’s also very convenient to be able to adjust it when there is a weather change.

title: It works
text:
There are 2 factors to consider with an underground irrigation system.  How much do I spend on water and how does my lawn look. Rachio gets 5 stars on both.  In my area of the country a manicured lawn needs a inch of rain of week (and a good landscaper).  Rachio delivers on the manicured lawn and cut my water bill in half.   

The unit paid for its self in the first six months.  In addition to saving money, I’m being ecological responsible by not over watering.  

I’m a rachio fan. 😀

title: Very frustrated
text: I have had this system for the last 3 summers with no problems, you change the format and I can’t get it to work right don’t even know how to get it to set up right. Set up for the rain delay and every time there’s a sprinkle outside it doesn’t water, but Still needs to be watered that takes all the convenience out of this because I have to watch my lawn constantly. I hate the new format I had no problems before this change. Where is the instructions “Rachio for dummies” It was so easy to set up before why did you change???  My yard  is burning up this summer because of this change

title: Ease of use near ang far
text: I like the ability of watering particular zones around my residence either at my home or when vacationing. This is very useful when you have a zone dedicated to a vegetable garden. I like the ability of changing the watering times in each designated zone remotely as opposed to physically making a timing change on other watering systems.

title: Deplorable George
text: Rachio is the best sprinkler control system I’ve even seen.   It makes irrigation so simple and smart.  System pays for itself by saving water.  Being able to control sprinklers from your phone makes it so easy to turn on zones at your discretion as well as easy control when evacuating system for winter,  if you do it yourself.

title: Best Water System Out There
text: We’ve had other sprinkler systems that consistently lost connectivity with our internet (Rainbird, I’m looking at you!).  Rachio so far has never lost the connection.  The app is easy to use, and gives you the options that let you decide how much and where to water.  Best purchase in lawn care I’ve made.

title: If you like full screen ads, you’ll love Rachio
text: When you’re walking your dog and the sprinklers come on, it’s not fun to open this app and have an full screen ad advertising a free feature of the paid add on service. Money grubbing punks. This dialog shows up every single time you open the app. I’ve had Rachio for several years now and have dealt with their previous bugs but this is completely abusing their relationship with their existing customers trying to upsell and never taking No as an answer.

title: Used to be great
text:
Now I can’t even do a quick run for all zones.  Schedule not updating when I change it.  You are killing my new plants. I may have to go back to manual sprinklers. Your update is horrible. Take me back to the previous version. It was user friendly. 
And you’re lucky I give you 1 star.  It’s the minimum.

title: App Update Jan 2020
text:
Your developers have outdone themselves this time!!!  Much needed updates in this most recent version of the app!!  Now that we can see both future and past irrigation activity on a calendar it is a game changer for me.  I also noticed you changed the “Yard” label back to “Zones”! 

Only suggestion, move the Lawn Smarts section to the “More” menu.

title: Versatility
text: Rachio has so many different features that allows you to customize each station to different watering needs. My husband and I each have a controller on our phone. He manages the lawn and I manage the flower beds. Rachio tracks your watering history and also sends tips and valuable information to you. We love it.

title: Great controller aye a little to high tech for the average homeowner
text: Though this controller can be operated by a novice it gets better as your knowledge grows. It’s geared more for the professional landscaper, golf course irrigation manager or home owner who is interested in the science of irrigation. The customer support is hands down the most friendliest, patient that I’ve ever encountered. They are so willing to teach the customer and answer any question you have.

title: Professional grade
text: So I am a landscape architect and a certified irrigation designer and I recommend all of my residential clients get the Rachio app and controller. It asks you questions about your yard and landscaping that help it water your plants in a more efficient way. You can also get a rebate from most municipalities for upgrading to it from a less water efficient controller.

title: Satisfied Minnesota customer
text: We were offered a discount on Rachio through our local town. It has been a fantastic water-saver and very easy to use. Also the remote feature is great. We often travel so I can always check and run all zones or individual zones remotely. My husband marvels at my ability to maintain a green, healthy lawn!

title: Forget Rainbird
text: I bought a Rachio controller for my last house and loved it. At the new house the builder said the company they use has rainbird and it’s a smart controller. I pushed back a little because I loved my Rachio. It they insisted it would be sufficient. It’s not. I bought me another Rachio and it is superior to the rainbird in every way as far as a smart device is concerned.

title: So convenient!
text: There is nothing like being able to water remotely. On any trip, at any distance, you can monitor what is happening in your garden. I never worry about whether the watering is done properly because I have set it up and can control it. The app is easy to use too. I highly recommend it.

title: Love my Rachio
text: Installed it myself last summer in 20 min. Took me several months to get it right with my various lawn zones and soil types. (I have a very big lawn) Since that time, it has been incredible. My overall lawn health is better and water bill is down roughly 20% versus the old system of just watering every other day. Go buy one!

title: Loss of important information
text: Why is the new interface showing in the first screen static information that does not give any added value? In version 3, usage data was displayed which was useful to have a quick glance at what happened with the watering. Not anymore. That’s disappointing.

title: Works Great Again
text: I love having control over sprinkler system with my phone and network. Had a problem with zone functionality for awhile, but latest update fixed this. I like being able to run, stop and adjust without going to controller in garage. The Smart features are working well and yard has never looked better.

title: Interface is WAY better
text: The interface for this app is so much better than it used to be. When I first got this app I love everything about it however the interface with Corky hard to understand and took a lot of getting used to. The new interface is a massive improvement makes it very easy to understand and operate.

title: What an improvement!
text: Since this was installed nearly a year ago I’ve really enjoyed the ease of use, mostly because the internet connectivity has worked flawlessly.   My old manual system of adjusting the timers, running short extra waterings, etc is now in the trash heap of history... and good riddance.

title: Nothing but trouble
text:
My local utility pitched Rachio as a great improvement with an attractive rebate for watering the yard. My ancient Rainbird worked okay, but I was lured by the promise of “something better”.
Now, instead of adjusting a static clock 2-4 times a year, I get to spend hours troubleshooting a silly, overly complex internet system on a quarterly, sometimes monthly basis. When the app crashes, as it will do, I have no recourse to run the sprinkler and drip, except to manually turn on valves in the yard one by one. If that’s progress, I’m a hummingbird.

title: May be my last Rachio product.
text: Please remove the constant stream of ads for the fertilizer service.     It is annoying to have a premium product swivel to a business model of constant advertising in the app.  If this continues to be the norm for your app I’ll move to a different product all together.

title: High tech!
text: Yes it tells you the moisture of your soil as well as soil nutrients. Automatically shuts off the system for rain, high winds, and freezing temps. If a sprinkler head is broken and the water is running too quickly, the system notifies you that there is a problem. I highly recommend this system!!!

title: Still lots of bugs
text:
Seems to lose track of when it ran what stations and how long they ran. This seems to happen if you manually water a zone or if you zero out the moisture level so it will run that day. Then it forgets it ran and wants to run again. 

I love the overall functionality and tracking of the watering amounts. Just wish they had the bugs solved and better stability.

title: Great APP to go along with great hardware.
text: Based on research I replaced our venerable RainBird controller (which still worked great but was 13 years old) with a Rachio. As expected, based on reviews, easy set up and great newer features. This app was just as intuitive and has worked great both remotely and through WiFi when I’m home.

title: Incredible software and hardware engineering combo
text: Rachio completely delivers as advertised. Simplicity and speed in a gorgeous package including the app. Love the small footprint of the hardware including the magnetic cover (why doesn’t every hanging device have this feature? Simple to install and 100% worked out of the box.

title: App issue
text: Son has program and loves, issue is that with my iPhone worked great for first day. Now can not open app.  App continues to only say where having trouble getting your account. I can access program and control on web but not access by app. They say fixed for new iPhones but I have a iPhone 8 so help. I like using the app when it worked.

title: Easy Lawn Care
text: My lawn watering has never been easier. When it rains a little…Rachio automatically waters less. When it rains a lot…Rachio doesn’t water. I love that it doesn’t water during high winds and waters in intervals to make sure everything soaks in. Just applied my first treatment of Lawn Champion and looking forward to seeing results!

title: Works great with a minor app bug
text:
I've been using the app and controller for a couple of weeks and so far it's great.

One minor issue with the app: after you open the app, if you click on the site next to your controller at the top it takes you to a page with no navigation arrows. You have to close the app to get back into it.

iPhone X IOS 14.7.1

title: Submitted bug report: Duplicate schedules
text:
I create a schedule and the app creates another schedule. I tried to delete the duplicate schedule but it deletes both schedules.

When I try to create a schedule now, the app displays: oops, take a snapshot and submit a bug report.

I deleted the app and installed the app again and there were no more duplicates. Changed from three Stars to five stars.

title: A Professional Application!
text:
Wow! What an update. I always new the app workflow could be better and it is. This new app makes this the best sprinkler controller out there. It gives so much control over every aspect of the system. 

One feature request would be to help simplify the setting up of a zone. There are so many variables that can effect watering times.

title: Works great, but requires faith
text: If you have a basic understanding of how lawns and plants use water, this is very easy and straightforward. The online tutorials are very helpful. I saw a bunch of 1 star reviews and wonder who they are that can’t get this to work. You can always call a professional to help I guess, but shouldn’t need to.

title: No support # or ease of connection

title: Residential Irrigation
text:

title: App update dumped my device

title: Great lawn watering management
text: My experience with Rachio 3 has been very positive over the past year. It manages my lawn watering automatically majority of the time. It is very easy to use, and very straightforward. As for the latest software update, sometimes the zone pictures are wrong and not showing up, which causes confusion...

title: Rachio
text: Absolutely love this remote sprinkler controller.  Provides great flexibility for altering programmed watering schedules.  This is especially useful when away from home and a temperature change requires more or less watering.  Great support team. Walked me through resolving a connectivity issue and quickly had me functioning normally again.

title: Money Saved
text: I’ve been using the Rachio 2 with this app for about a year and I love that I never have to think about the grass being watered. Setting the threshold for rain, it’s knowledge of soil saturation , it’s all been great. When we move, the next owners will have to buy their own station, this is coming with.

title: So far, GREAT
text:
This is the first time I. 25 years that I’ve been able to easily program my 9-zone sprinkler system.  Replacement of the old box was quick and easy.  It DOES take a while to name and configure the zones. 
The old mechanical box that it replaced was so difficult that we simply told it to run through all the zones once in a while when we thought about it.  
NOW, I’m making schedules and enjoying truly automated control. 
In the setup, I discovered two inoperative zones. I need to locate and fix the solenoids or figure out why they’re not energizing. Don’t know how long inop. 
Wish Rachio had a “Chatter “ mode to aid in  solenoid diagnosis. 
Now, I’m motivated to reconfigure my heads and group them into beds versus yard. Project time!

title: Good overall with opportunities for enhancements
text: I like the overall ease of starting and stopping different zones. Would like to have the option of having different programmed settings that I create and save in a library and activate as a group at different times but there seems to be a restriction on putting a zone in two groups.

title: Awesome love it!!
text: Just replaced our hunter controller with the Rachio and the app is just awesome. So easy to setup. Now I can turn different zones on from anywhere at any time. Super reliable communication not always a given with wifi stuff. Love how you can set pics of the zones so you know which ones are which.

title: Great app but..
text:
I love the Rachio watering system. The only thing I would like to see is the “rain skip” notification sent a little earlier. 
My watering is at 0300. The rain-skip notification comes in well after midnight. For me to have a chance of overriding it I would like to get the notification before I go to bed. Most of the time it already knows that the ground is saturated many hours before.

title: One of my favorite toys and tools!
text: I never thought having sprinklers could be any easier until I got this.  Checking sprinkler heads and changing settings have never been so easy.  Also delaying schedules due to rain is a breeze if it doesn’t already do it by itself.  I love it!

title: Watering system
text:
Rachio watering system is one of the best systems and easy to use,  it doesn’t take a rocket scientist to install it, and to use the app.
I am confident to say that I do 110% recommend this watering system. Like the old commercial SET IT AND FORGET IT,  I hope this was helpful to  anyone interested in purchasing this product

title: Zone 9a
text: The best invention!  Incredible for trouble shooting saves time from running back and forth, it makes it easy to resolve areas where water is needed and to reduce water in the shaded areas. In addition, I use drip to baskets and wine barrel garden.  It allows me to adjust water requirements day and night based upon weather and conservation.

title: Great Irrigation Controller
text:
I just upgraded to Gen 3 that is Home Kit compatible but main reason was because it can use a flow meter. I had a huge water bill caused by a leaking valve. This will fix that. 

I have never had an issue with the app. Mine works great. The upgrade was very smooth and app walks you through step by step. So simple even a cave man could do it!  🤤

title: Great product/poor interface
text:
Love the concept and certain parts of the execution are near flawlessly (setting up the controller on a Wi-Fi network as an example).

Other parts of useful and I’d say more common features are buried deep in the interface. 

It makes me concerned that I have the configuration set properly. I don’t want to run my sprinklers constantly and since I’m not sure how they will react (unclear interface) I only use the system when I can physically monitor it.

title: Best Purchase
text: We were constantly adjusting and readjusting sprinkler settings due to weather and seasonsl changes. It was so frustrating trying to get it right. This system gives us the freedom to water mor or less by station and add a manual run if there is a dry spot.  And I can make adjustments from my couch.

title: Schedule always changes in middle of night
text: I came home last night and it was raining. It rained all night. I check the Rachio at 11:30pm, which I set to adjust the program daily for the most flexibility. Not supposed to run until Monday. At 3am I get notifications that weather has changed and then it runs. It does this all the time! What good is a smart controller if you need to babysit it? A colleague who also has this says he leaves his in “standby” mode which is basically leaving it off. Very frustrating.

title: Great Product
text: Easy to use, easy to automate if needed. With the heavy rain we get here I use it manually to ensure the right level of watering. It is crazy how many sprinklers I see running with either heavy rain forecasted or after heavy rain. This fixes that and saves money on the watering at the same time !

title: Perfect for Beginners
text:
I am completely new to lawn care and decent at handyman stuff. I replaced the Hunter control with the Rachio on my own and to my surprise, it works! The user interface of the app is friendly and not confusing at all. I’m loving this app!
If you don’t get this for you, it’s perfect as a gift for a homeowner!

title: Rachio

title: Horrible updated software, no landscape mode

title: Review

title: Easy!

title: Smart water control
text: I’m very happy with this feature it makes save water in the long run,very efficient and you can control the water of your smartphone. Every time the lawn is getting water it let you know. Great product I really really recommend it….

title: Great app- very easy to use!

Treat your environment plus wallets well and get one yourself.

title: Ease of use!

title: Terrible

title: Outstanding Irrigation Control

title: What a great system!

title: Residential Lawn

title: Great system
text: I was used to conventional sprinklers prior with the old timer box and even use sprinklers with the manual on off valves. This system has been the best thing ever for me and my family. It is trouble free and I love all the help and assistance that’s offered in the different categories.

title: Easy setup.  Works like a charm

title: Just needs one thing…
